newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Telecom shares up on sale talk.
newsitem.headline: HK Telecom shares up on sale talk.

text.p: Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd shares rose in early Thursday trade on reports China United Telecommunications Corp (China Unicom) had held talks with Cable and Wireless Plc, Hongkong Telecom's main shareholder.

Hongkong Telecom shares were up HK$0.15 at HK$14.35 after a local newspaper quoted China Unicom's president, Li Huifen, as saying China Unicom had been in talks with C&W about investing in Hongkong Telecom.
"We think it's possibly true. The evidence is there," said an analyst with a local brokerage, adding that it would be a "less than ideal" marriage for Hongkong Telecom.
But others said a linkup between China Unicom and Hongkong Telecom was unlikely
"I don't think it's very likely that there will be a deal with Unicom. It is not a logical partner for Hongkong Telecom," said Andrew Hall of Kleinwort Benson Securities (Asia).
Analysts said financing was also a problem for China Unicom.
"They (China Unicom) have no money," said Morgan Stanley analyst Jeff Camp.
China Unicom is a mainland joint venture of 16 major organisations led by the ministries of power, railways and electronics industry.
C&W owns 58.5 percent of Hongkong Telecom.
